history.text: Hey how are you?
Hi! hows it going?
Good, just got done watching Monsters University, such a cute movie!
Yeah? What is it about?
Its a cartoon, have you seen Monsters Inc?
Yeah, I thought it was a good movie.
Its the prequel to Monsters Inc. It is about the two main characters' time in college! Mike and Sulley
Do you think it is as good as Monsters Inc?
No, I think its a cute movie but I have to agree with the critics, it isn't always best to turn over old ground
What rating did the critics give the movie?
It averaged 6.8/10 and 79% on Rotten Tomatoes. Sometimes you just cant do as good as the first movie I guess
Its shows the story of them studying in scare school. Mike and Sulley start off as rivals.
OK. What made the movie not as good? Was it the character development, the plot, etc?
The plot. I think its hard to follow the story, knowing how the two end up working together and being best friends!
Mike works hard in school while Sulley is is privileged, coming from a family of talented scarers. So they don't start off on good terms
Yeah, Im not sure if that part of monster Inc needed a whole movie to develop the character relationship. I havent heard much about the movie, so I guess that means it was really popular.
They actually both fail Monsters University in the beginning of the movie.
But they were able to get right back in?
Well, Mike enters the "scare games" in which he can either get reinstated or leave for good.
He joins the weakest fraternity, Oozma Kappa. Sulley ends up joining the team too.
Is that like a knock off of the Hunger Games or gladiator style fighting?
Gladiator style, challenges they have to do. They all work together to get through the challenges and do really well. Mike & Sulley seem to form a bond, until the final round
So a predictable relationship fallout that resolves by the end of the movie.
Would you recommend the movie?
If so, what age group would enjoy the movie?
Mike gets upset because Sulley tampered with a machine in a simulation room. He sets it to the easiest setting so they win.
I think kids will enjoy it! My daughters 2 & 4 love it.
But in the end, they end up making up and actually taking jobs at Monsters, Inc. In the mail room
So I guess it is a PG movie?
Definitely PG!
I rarely enjoy sequels or prequels but this one is a cute kids movie.
OK, Ill have to keep that in mind as my son gets old enough to watch movies.
I think he will enjoy. Cant go wrong with Pixar movies!
I think that your summary will be very helpful in further deciding if and when to see it.
I'm glad!!

uid1response.feedback: It sounded like a decent family movie. I am not currently eager to watch the movie but as my kids grow up, I will probably watch the movie at least one time.
